Three years ago, you helped us launch XOAB, our vision of comfortable socks in beautiful designs. Since then, thousands of you have enjoyed them.
This time around, we’re introducing something new, XOAB Active compression socks. Here's the quick summary:
<ul>
<li>
Design forward. Using our proprietary design software we can create an unprecedented range of patterned compression socks. Great designs, lots of colors, no limits.
<li>

Guaranteed comfort. We’ve created a state-of-the-art testing device to verify the fit in complex patterned compression socks, so there’s no guesswork finding the right size. We’ll ask you for a few measurements and send you the right socks.
<li>
100% Made in the USA. We design and make all the socks on our own machines from quality materials: American innovation, American materials, American manufacturing.
<li>
Still kicking! After three years, we’re still brothers, enjoying inventing and designing.

Compression socks have been around a long time, you say? That’s true, but in limited patterns and colors. The long-established compression companies mostly sell socks in three colors, white, flesh-tone and black.
A small number of companies are doing patterned compression socks in the market, and we started this project thinking we could bring our design skills to the party, and offer more choices.
Not so fast.

We discovered that the state-of-the-art in measurement tools for compression socks can’t always measure patterned socks accurately. It just wasn’t possible to accurately verify the compression of our complex patterns. That was our first hurdle.
And, the testing devices that were available were only used in labs, sometimes needing weeks to return compression test results on a pair of socks. And that was our second challenge.
In a knitting mill, machine set-up can change from day to day
column2: reproducing exactly what was done on a knitting machine weeks before can be problematic. Stretch will vary across different batches of the same kind of yarn. Some colors dyed from the same batch of yarn stretch differently than other colors. Without an accurate measuring system, one we could use right next to our knitting machines, we couldn’t verify the compression in our patterned socks, much less take advantage of the prototyping speed and versatility afforded by our unique design software.
>Our software analyzes a pattern and creates a knitting machine program to eliminate float threads, allowing the sock to stretch.

column1: In 2015, we were granted a patent on our process for analyzing complex sock patterns and redesigning them so they stretch enough for all sizes of legs. That process  turned out to be more important than we realized, as the float threads in patterns interfere with the compression applied by a sock, and make accurate compression measurements more difficult.

Over the last two years, with a lot of trial and error, we’ve created a device we can use to measure any of our patterned socks accurately, and it can be used at the mill, next to our knitting machines.

We were made aware of compression socks by a friend and sock industry veteran who wore them exclusively. Rick wore them while working at our mill. The mill floor is concrete, so the knitting machines get a thin layer of plywood under them to reduce vibration. That helps the machines age gracefully - as for the rest of us, not so much. Almost all knitting work is done standing up, and at the end of a long day, wearing compression socks makes a big difference.

Compression socks do their magic by squeezing your legs. (The name “compression” might be a giveaway. :) They can help your legs feel better and you feel less tired by helping your circulatory system move blood, lactic acid, carbon dioxide and excess water from your muscles upward from your feet and lower legs. Travelers also know that compression socks can help keep feet from swelling when flying. For athletes, runners, cyclists, climbers and anyone who fights gravity when they exercise, compression socks may help with performance and recovery.

The challenge we faced was that we needed a measurement device that we could use at the mill, and one that would work on all our patterns. Most current measurement devices, like the one shown in our video, work by measuring the tension of a sock’s fabric, and use a simplified form of a partial differential equation known as the Young-Laplace equation to infer the pressure on a theoretical leg from that sock. The catch is that unless a sock has a flat, solid-color area where the device’s sensor measures tension, the sock’s pattern can disrupt the tension readings. And, these testing devices are expensive
column2: the only ones we have access to are in third-party testing labs.

column1: So we started tinkering, and built our own tester. The solution we came up with is to read a sock’s pressure directly, without the need for the tension-to-pressure conversion. We use a sensitive electronic pressure transducer attached to an air-filled rubber tube around a “measurement disk.” Each measurement disk is sized to a precise outer circumference, and reports how much a sock is squeezing that disk. We then stack up a “leg” of these measurement disks, where each disk’s outer circumference corresponds to either a segment of an industry standard leg or of a specific person’s leg. We connect our stack of measurement disks to a computer and we can read the exact pressure curve for a sock. We use the pressure data from the device to modify the parameters in the knitting machine program, and correct any pressure variation from the ideal sock we wanted to knit.

column2: >Our sock tester is a stack of disks, each sized to the correct circumference on a leg. There's an electronic pressure transducer with some custom electronics in the middle of each disk, to report the pressure on that section of the leg.

column1: Because our device is easy to use, and can quickly take a pressure reading from any sock, we can also use it to start answering questions about compression socks that nobody knows the answers to yet, because of the difficulty in getting them tested. We’re looking forward to understanding how our socks change from when you put them on in the morning until you take them off at night, or how the socks change over many wearings and washings.

column2: >CAD drawing, 3D printing and sealed, completed ""caterpillar"" connectors for the pressure tubes in the disk units.

column1: So far, we’ve built lots of prototypes, and have our first working “leg.” With your support, we’ll be able to create a range of interchangeable disks and several measurement legs. We’ll be fine-tuning the usability of the device, working on our software to read the measurements, and integrating the pressure measurements into our knitting workflow.

To work well, compression socks are “graduated,” meaning they are tighter at your foot and ankle, and “gradually” get looser towards your calf. It’s the smooth reduction in pressure, from bottom to top, that make them effective.

The pressure of compression socks is measured in “millimeters of mercury,” the same units of measurement used for your blood pressure. It’s abbreviated “mmHg.” (“Hg” is the symbol for the metal mercury, from its New Latin name, hydrargyrum, which means ""liquid silver."" In the dark ages, before dials, lights and Netflix, pressure gauges were made from a glass tube, filled with a column of mercury, and the scale next to the tube was a millimeter ruler.)

If your blood pressure reading is 120/80, for instance, that’s a pressure of 120 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) when your heart beats, and 80 mmHg when your heart is resting. Compression socks, for normal, non-medical use, exert considerably less pressure than your blood pressure, so blood will still flow easily in your legs.

Compression socks are categorized by the amount of pressure they apply at their tightest point, which is at the ankle. Because peoples’ legs vary in size, the same sock might be tighter if your ankle is larger, or less tight if your ankle is slimmer. We’ve chosen to make our standard socks 15-20 mmHg at the ankle. That means that depending on the size of your foot and ankle, we will provide socks that compress your ankle with a pressure somewhere between 15 and 20 mmHg. The top of our socks, at the largest part of the calf, will be about 30-35% less pressure, depending on the size of your calf, gradually lessening from the 15-20 mmHg at the ankle.

(For those of you wanting other pressures, or if you want a more precise fit, exactly customized to your legs, see our “Individual custom sizing reward,” below. They cost more, but we will work with you to achieve a perfect compression gradient for the shape of your legs.)

In return for helping us get our testing invention off the ground, you get the very first compression socks we make, in a size that fits you. You'll be able to pick from among the designs we show here, plus any that we add over the course of the project. You can mix and match any of these designs for your reward.
The compression socks for this project will be knit from US-grown and spun Supima® combed cotton and 18.5 micron American Merino wool.
A custom design for your team or group

For $2,000, we will knit five dozen pairs of compression socks for your peloton of cyclists, ward of nurses, courtroom of lawyers or any other pod, gaggle or herd. Neil will work with you to adapt your design to be a successful compression sock pattern, or he can create a design from the ideas and artwork you provide. We'll provide a sample of the finished sock for your approval, and then we'll knit the socks in the specific sizes needed by everyone in your group. (Yes, we'll need to collect some measurements from them, but we’ll give you a custom on-line survey for that.) $2,000 is $33 and change per pair, which is much less than our single-pair price for this project.
Sizing

Have you ever been frustrated with a size chart, and end up guessing which size to buy? Us too. While we’ll be producing “standard” sizes in our compression socks, for this project we decided to help with that. Instead of giving you a size chart, we’re going to ask for a few measurements of your foot and leg. Using those measurements, we’ll choose the right size compression socks for you, from our standard range.

Sizing compression socks is a little more complicated than regular socks. With regular socks, we can usually guide you to the correct sock size if we know your shoe size. Unfortunately, the compression in socks, ie how much they squeeze your leg, changes depending on the size of your leg and your height, not just your shoe size.
We’re going to have several “standard” sizes
column2: variations for smaller and larger feet, smaller and larger calves, and shorter and taller people. But you don’t have to worry about guessing the correct size – we’ll use your measurements, and make sure you get socks that fit. In the process, you’ll be helping us fine-tune our sizing, adjusting the size ranges to make sure we can fit all your feet.

column1: (We guarantee the sizing. It’s part of our unconditional guarantee. If you don’t think they fit, we’ll fix ‘em.)
New designs but no stretch goals

If you’ve backed other apparel corwdfunding projects, you’ll have noticed that projects frequently offer new designs or colors as stretch goals. Most apparel projects need to secure enough pre-orders to justify ordering a minimum quantity of each design. For socks, those minimums might be thousands of pairs for each design, possibly thousands in each different color combination.

We’re not offering new designs as stretch goals, simply because adding new designs is something we do easily, without minimums. Any of you who have seen our monthly First Editions subscription offerings know that we create new designs easily, in lots of colorways, and can decide exactly how many we knit at a time.

What we guarantee for this project is that you’ll be able to choose from any of the compression designs you see here. In addition, by the time we ask you to choose your socks, we’ll even have more possibilities for you to pick from. We’ve included some of your favorite patterns from our regular line and we may offer new ones in addition to what you see here. If there are colors, patterns or styles you’d like to see, please let us know! One of the things we like about project is the wealth of suggestions and ideas you bring to us!

With four knitting machines, we have the capacity to scale our manufacturing to accommodate the volume this campaign may generate. Although we may be adding more designs to the offerings for this project, we will not go beyond a point where any added complexity would jeopardize timely fulfillment.
Delivering your socks
This time around, we’re packaging socks in envelopes, rather than gift boxes, to reduce some packaging and weight. Shipping to the US is included in the price of your reward.

The international shipping rates for our last project were a bit steep: the costs for packages ranged from $10 to more than $30. Since almost 30% of backers for our first project lived outside the US, we don’t feel comfortable up-charging for all the shipping, especially since we’re covering US postage. As a compromise, we’re going to split the shipping with our international backers – the shipping fee we’ve added for international delivery should cover half our expenses, and we’ll spot you for the rest.
You might get your socks in multiple packages

If you choose a reward with more than one pair of socks, we may not wait until we knit all your socks to send you some. As backers from our first project may remember, we shipped more than 360 variations of pattern, color, fiber and size last time – and every possible variation was chosen by at least one backer! We ended up having to make all your socks before we could ship any, resulting in frustrating delays for you and for us.

We’re not doing that again! This time, if we have some socks made for you, we’re going to ship them, and you might get more than one delivery. Shipping to US backers is still free, no matter how many packages we send you. For international backers, the one-time fee is all you’ll pay, even if we send your socks in more than one bundle.

Ever notice that many sock companies do design and marketing but don’t knit their own socks? We discovered early on that we needed to have more control over our manufacturing than we could get from an arms-length relationship with a knitting mill.

The typical out-sourcing process for socks starts with a designer creating a rough sketch of a sock design, and sending it to a contract knitting mill, sometimes in the US, but more likely overseas. For more complex patterns, at the mill, a programmer reworks the design, often simplifying it to run on a knitting machine. Then, the programmer will give the design program to a knitter, specifying colors from the mill’s yarn inventory. The end result is an approximation of a designer’s intent, but very often more of a compromise than the designer would like.

To make our socks, we had to import our own custom-modified knitting machines, develop design and analysis software to help make Neil’s designs knit well, source high-quality undyed cotton and wool yarn, dye a wide range of colors and learn how to run small batches of socks quickly and efficiently. It’s not possible to produce our socks if we contract out our manufacturing. Our innovation and quality stem directly from our hands on approach, so the socks we make are precisely the ones Neil intended.

Neil and I are reminded every day that we’re standing on the shoulders of many talented people who have helped us and advised us since we started XOAB. They’ve kept us going, on track, and encouraged us not to quit when we’ve been feeling discouraged.

Dan St. Louis and Tony Whitener at the Manufacturing Solutions Center, in Conover, NC continue to be our go-to experts on the sock industry. When we’ve had questions, we’ve ended up on their doorstep time and again, and they keep answering. Thank you.

Next, we have to thank our loyal customers for taking a chance on a fledgling sock company, sticking with us, and spreading the word as we've worked on perfecting what many of you have told us to be the best socks you own. We rely on your feedback and gentle encouragement to improve what we do - please don't stop letting us know what you think!

We continue to rely on KentWool in Pickens, SC and Buhler Quality Yarns in Jefferson, GA for spinning the undyed yarn we use to make our socks. Lucy Reynolds and Tim Manson at Meridian Specialty Yarns make it possible to dye our amazing colors. Andy Rhoney and the team at Catawba Paper Box create our exquisite gift boxes.
Our knitting machines from Gianmario Busi and his team in Brescia run sock after sock, and live up daily to their reputation as the best pattern sock machines in the world.

Chris Crowley, Bob Nichols and Dean Miller provided invaluable mechanical and electrical design work to get our prototype tester off the ground. Naomi Levine provided CAD assistance to get our prototyping started. We printed and cut legions of parts for our prototypes and experiments at TechShop in San Jose.
Brian McKinney’s consummate skill created the software systems at the core of our business, and made it possible to run XOAB across 3,000 miles of US geography.

We’re incredibly grateful to Mike Pope and Martha Holmes, who keep our mill and machines running, organize us, and almost always say yes to our off-the-wall ideas for socks and designs. (And when Rick comes up with a new, hare-brained knitting technique, they almost always don’t mean it when they say “don’t let Neil know about that.” :)

For this project, our theme song is again the track ""Looking For a River"" by Hannah Alkire and Joe Scott of Acoustic Eidolon. We can’t get it out of our heads! Their latest album, ""A Tree Finds Its Voice"" showcases the incredible pair of new instruments made for them from one piece of wood, and will be out in late October.
David Levine recorded the narration for our video, and did the final audio mix.
Karen Kuhn is the creative powerhouse behind all the lifestyle photography of our socks
column2: her wonderful eye for color and form yields magical images.

column1: Sarah Levine consulted on the use of compression socks in microgravity environments and provided bicycling images.

Next to last, we thank our family – Sue for putting up with Rick’s entrepreneurial proclivities and our mom, Myra Levine for believing in us and suggesting we work together. We still wish our dad was around to see what we’re doing
And finally, thanks to each other. Without each other, none of this would be possible
Risks and challenges

This is our second crowdfunding project. Our first one was quite a ride, and we learned a lot from the experience! We delivered more than 6,000 pairs of socks, spread out over 336 separate design, colorway, yarn and size variations, to more than 1,200 backers in more than 30 countries.

This time around, we’re more sure of our sock knitting chops, and very comfortable with the nuts and bolts of running a high quality sock business. We’ve improved our knitting processes and tools, and we’ve taken much of your feedback to heart, and made improvements to our socks, like more heel and toe reinforcement and tweaks to sizing. We started the last project with only one knitting machine in production, and now we have four running, with a four-fold increase in our daily production capacity.

We’re also taking a few steps to simplify our work for this project. First, we’re not going to produce as many variations, which simplifies our manufacturing work. Second, we’re going to ship socks to you in envelopes, rather than gift boxes, to save shipping cost and packing material.
And, we’re not going to wait until we’ve knit all the socks if you choose a multi-sock reward
column2: you’ll very likely get more than one shipment from us, to get you socks sooner. (With no extra shipping charge to you.)

column1: We’re sure we’ll hit some snags along the way – we’re trying something new, and still developing some of the techniques we’ll use to produce and test our compression socks. However, backers of our first project have already experienced our persistence firsthand. We don’t quit. We’ve been told by one kind backer that we’re not really a sock business, but a customer service company that happens to sell socks. We’re very intent on keeping our focus on service and on your complete happiness with our socks, and hope you’ll join us in our newest venture, making the most comfortable, beautiful compression socks in the world.
","Three years ago, you helped us launch XOAB, our vision of comfortable socks in beautiful designs. Since then, thousands of you have enjoyed them.
This time around, we’re introducing something new, XOAB Active compression socks. Here's the quick summary:
Design forward. Using our proprietary design software we can create an unprecedented range of patterned compression socks. Great designs, lots of colors, no limits.

Guaranteed comfort. We’ve created a state-of-the-art testing device to verify the fit in complex patterned compression socks, so there’s no guesswork finding the right size. We’ll ask you for a few measurements and send you the right socks.
100% Made in the USA. We design and make all the socks on our own machines from quality materials: American innovation, American materials, American manufacturing.
Still kicking! After three years, we’re still brothers, enjoying inventing and designing.

Compression socks have been around a long time, you say? That’s true, but in limited patterns and colors. The long-established compression companies mostly sell socks in three colors, white, flesh-tone and black.
A small number of companies are doing patterned compression socks in the market, and we started this project thinking we could bring our design skills to the party, and offer more choices.
Not so fast.

We discovered that the state-of-the-art in measurement tools for compression socks can’t always measure patterned socks accurately. It just wasn’t possible to accurately verify the compression of our complex patterns. That was our first hurdle.
And, the testing devices that were available were only used in labs, sometimes needing weeks to return compression test results on a pair of socks. And that was our second challenge.
In a knitting mill, machine set-up can change from day to day
column2: reproducing exactly what was done on a knitting machine weeks before can be problematic. Stretch will vary across different batches of the same kind of yarn. Some colors dyed from the same batch of yarn stretch differently than other colors. Without an accurate measuring system, one we could use right next to our knitting machines, we couldn’t verify the compression in our patterned socks, much less take advantage of the prototyping speed and versatility afforded by our unique design software.

column1: Our software analyzes a pattern and creates a knitting machine program to eliminate float threads, allowing the sock to stretch.

In 2015, we were granted a patent on our process for analyzing complex sock patterns and redesigning them so they stretch enough for all sizes of legs. That process  turned out to be more important than we realized, as the float threads in patterns interfere with the compression applied by a sock, and make accurate compression measurements more difficult.

Over the last two years, with a lot of trial and error, we’ve created a device we can use to measure any of our patterned socks accurately, and it can be used at the mill, next to our knitting machines.

We were made aware of compression socks by a friend and sock industry veteran who wore them exclusively. Rick wore them while working at our mill. The mill floor is concrete, so the knitting machines get a thin layer of plywood under them to reduce vibration. That helps the machines age gracefully - as for the rest of us, not so much. Almost all knitting work is done standing up, and at the end of a long day, wearing compression socks makes a big difference.

Compression socks do their magic by squeezing your legs. (The name “compression” might be a giveaway. :) They can help your legs feel better and you feel less tired by helping your circulatory system move blood, lactic acid, carbon dioxide and excess water from your muscles upward from your feet and lower legs. Travelers also know that compression socks can help keep feet from swelling when flying. For athletes, runners, cyclists, climbers and anyone who fights gravity when they exercise, compression socks may help with performance and recovery.

The challenge we faced was that we needed a measurement device that we could use at the mill, and one that would work on all our patterns. Most current measurement devices, like the one shown in our video, work by measuring the tension of a sock’s fabric, and use a simplified form of a partial differential equation known as the Young-Laplace equation to infer the pressure on a theoretical leg from that sock. The catch is that unless a sock has a flat, solid-color area where the device’s sensor measures tension, the sock’s pattern can disrupt the tension readings. And, these testing devices are expensive
column2: the only ones we have access to are in third-party testing labs.

column1: So we started tinkering, and built our own tester. The solution we came up with is to read a sock’s pressure directly, without the need for the tension-to-pressure conversion. We use a sensitive electronic pressure transducer attached to an air-filled rubber tube around a “measurement disk.” Each measurement disk is sized to a precise outer circumference, and reports how much a sock is squeezing that disk. We then stack up a “leg” of these measurement disks, where each disk’s outer circumference corresponds to either a segment of an industry standard leg or of a specific person’s leg. We connect our stack of measurement disks to a computer and we can read the exact pressure curve for a sock. We use the pressure data from the device to modify the parameters in the knitting machine program, and correct any pressure variation from the ideal sock we wanted to knit.

Our sock tester is a stack of disks, each sized to the correct circumference on a leg. There's an electronic pressure transducer with some custom electronics in the middle of each disk, to report the pressure on that section of the leg.

Because our device is easy to use, and can quickly take a pressure reading from any sock, we can also use it to start answering questions about compression socks that nobody knows the answers to yet, because of the difficulty in getting them tested. We’re looking forward to understanding how our socks change from when you put them on in the morning until you take them off at night, or how the socks change over many wearings and washings.
CAD drawing, 3D printing and sealed, completed ""caterpillar"" connectors for the pressure tubes in the disk units.

So far, we’ve built lots of prototypes, and have our first working “leg.” With your support, we’ll be able to create a range of interchangeable disks and several measurement legs. We’ll be fine-tuning the usability of the device, working on our software to read the measurements, and integrating the pressure measurements into our knitting workflow.

To work well, compression socks are “graduated,” meaning they are tighter at your foot and ankle, and “gradually” get looser towards your calf. It’s the smooth reduction in pressure, from bottom to top, that make them effective.

The pressure of compression socks is measured in “millimeters of mercury,” the same units of measurement used for your blood pressure. It’s abbreviated “mmHg.” (“Hg” is the symbol for the metal mercury, from its New Latin name, hydrargyrum, which means ""liquid silver."" In the dark ages, before dials, lights and Netflix, pressure gauges were made from a glass tube, filled with a column of mercury, and the scale next to the tube was a millimeter ruler.)

If your blood pressure reading is 120/80, for instance, that’s a pressure of 120 millimeters of mercury (mmHg) when your heart beats, and 80 mmHg when your heart is resting. Compression socks, for normal, non-medical use, exert considerably less pressure than your blood pressure, so blood will still flow easily in your legs.

Compression socks are categorized by the amount of pressure they apply at their tightest point, which is at the ankle. Because peoples’ legs vary in size, the same sock might be tighter if your ankle is larger, or less tight if your ankle is slimmer. We’ve chosen to make our standard socks 15-20 mmHg at the ankle. That means that depending on the size of your foot and ankle, we will provide socks that compress your ankle with a pressure somewhere between 15 and 20 mmHg. The top of our socks, at the largest part of the calf, will be about 30-35% less pressure, depending on the size of your calf, gradually lessening from the 15-20 mmHg at the ankle.

(For those of you wanting other pressures, or if you want a more precise fit, exactly customized to your legs, see our “Individual custom sizing reward,” below. They cost more, but we will work with you to achieve a perfect compression gradient for the shape of your legs.)

In return for helping us get our testing invention off the ground, you get the very first compression socks we make, in a size that fits you. You'll be able to pick from among the designs we show here, plus any that we add over the course of the project. You can mix and match any of these designs for your reward.

DaySling is a classic reborn and ready to be worn for another quarter century. Let's take a look of the sneak peak of DaySling &

What is the max. carries of DaySling? No matter you are a person like to carry everything you may need, or a person like to go light &
column2: fast everyday. DaySling will always suit with your daily carry style. Don't need two different size bags......ONLY DaySling!

column1: <div>
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/ypoiGf7Y4Rk?autohide=1&amp

At CYCOP, we've rethought traditional bags and crafted an agile, versatile pack that keeps up with your active life -without dragging you down. Classically modern, DaySling embraces the needs of modern exploration.

DaySling™ / the Modern Day Pack: Beyond Velcro, quiet resides. Welcome the new Whisper Closures, found on all DaySling packs. We live in a world of tablets, smartphones - small &
column2:
light. Shouldn't our carry gear follow suit? 

DaySling is not a big bag. It's designed to go with you everywhere, being perfectly at home on the trail, commute or even in a meeting. Let's state one thing clearly: these aren't just ordinary bags. DaySling is the distinctive sling that meets your daily needs. It's a compact pack that can expand when you need it to.

At CYCOP We've set out to develop a bag that is so comfortable and can be worn all day, meet multiple needs, something that has great functionality while minimizing weight and maximizing comfort.

No matter what you've packed, you will be able to find it, access it without removing your pack, without wrinkling your clothes.

Dazzle those Irises - Your gear is stowed safely inside, so let’s make it easy to see. Light interior colors highlight your stuff, rather than hide it. 

Placement of dividers &
column3:
quick access pockets is nothing short of zen. DaySling’s hidden pocket is right at the top of the strap - quietly concealed in plain sight. A built-in sunglasses pouch is right at your fingertips and crafted with ultra-smooth microfiber.

Juice up - DaySling’s Power Bank Pass-thru enables charging on the go while keeping your tablet separate &
column4:
safe.

Subtlety Brilliant - Who said soft fabrics can’t connect? Our back pocket closes with a system you’ve never seen before. No zips, no buttons, no noise. Whisper Closures are possibly the most magical experience of the whole bag. Soft as a blanket and ultra quiet: Every time you're in a meeting, library or even out in nature, using the Whisper Closure will bring a subtle smile to your face.

Just that Easy to Get- Access important belongings without even looking at your pack. One hand access to passports, bike locks and other needed items is a seamless experience with the hidden rear pocket.

 

Fit Your Daily Life and Adventure! 20 minute errand? 3 hour bike ride? An overnight? DaySling allows you to adjust its size based on your needs. The cargo space can transform from a 6 liter capacity to 13 liters in less than 5 seconds.

Optimize your access - The Expandable pocket combines with L-shape water-tight zipper to ensure you can get your stuff from A &
column5:
B side. Grasp a camera or a bottle of water, it is just that easy.

Precision at every point - Machine-sculpted cinch hooks enable smooth adjustment, no clicking required. Compression straps at the side and base ensure your belongings are secure.  Don't mention DaySling that is able to be your instant hanger for lock, jacket, and even helmet.

Introducing the Whisper Pod. For larger treks, you’re gonna take more stuff with you, and that means it can be kind of a hassle finding your things, and one way to sort these things out is using Whisper Pods. Whisper pods have two different sizes (standard &
column6:
mini), are perfect for keeping your gear in it place.

When packing clothes, you can pack small items in the mash pocket. When caring electronic items, it can be convenient to store larger items under the mash pocket. Standard Whisper Pod is with a coat hanger hook enables you to place this over the door, so you can easily visualize your items.

Find your way to organize - Thanks for the Whisper Closure material, the external fabric of Whisper Pod has adhering function that prevent it from sliding around. This promotes easier packing and unpacking. The inside of the DaySling also has adhering fabric, which enables best placement of the Whisper Pod for ideal weight distribution.  

 See how magical Whisper Pod could stable inside of luggage.

Don’t worry about the rain. Zippers are often the Achilles heel of packs - allowing in even the slightest drops of water. DaySling has you covered with water-tight zippers on all external openings. Its silver TPU seal prevents the water away!

The external textile of DaySling also used weatherproof polyester to ensure you to cope with any kind of weather condition.

Today’s lifestyle is directed by “living” in luxury markets and at the same time wearing modern, comfortable and affordable clothes and shoes. Somewhere in between we believe that buying luxury products is equal to having the best ones with the finest quality.

But how true is this ?

The idea of luxury is that it’s exclusive for you, but we forget that sometimes, or most of the time the price of the product is artificially inflate, making it far from friendly on our bank account.

   

 

Our aim is to create a shoe, which works for everyone, wherever they are going, giving a modern everyday look, with stylish luxury designs, without paying traditional luxury prices.

Martin Walker shoes are created keeping in mind the fact that the shoes must be comfortable, affordable, stylish and in high quality as well, integrating traditional and modern for the today gentleman.

Our Martin Walkers are Handcrafted with the Finest Grade of Genuine Italian Suede  and high quality fabrics with stylish textures, comfort for daily use.

We believe that a luxury pair of shoes doesn’t have to be expensive, but it can be both beautiful and qualitative. We’ve created a shoe, which has very high quality but with affordable price, cutting the middleman and extra costs, being shipped direct-to-you.

 

We have created two collections, made in a choice of eight beautifully genuine Italian suede leather and four high quality fabrics with stylish texture, giving the standard of a high and comfort everyday good looking.

 

 

 

 

Our MartinWalkers are with you from morning to evening, all day long! Each of them can be used in different styles, matching with your daily routine.

 

You don't want from a pair of shoes just to be beautiful, do you? Our Martin Walkers have many features, but at the same time giving a timeless design for customers.

 

In today markets, you can find a luxury pair of shoes from 400$ up to more than that. The difference between our MartinWalker’s and traditional brands is that we have cut out expensive marketing campaigns, retail markups &
column2:
distribution as well.

We are focused to a direct-to-consumer approach, selecting the best raw materials, producing with high quality, trying to keep our logistic chain and advertising costs to a bare minimum.
column4:
>Every piece of raw material is carefully picked out focusing on the details and design. We want the best for our clients that’s why we were so picky about having everything made with quality and in a timeless design.

We have collaborated with small artisan’s family owned factories to produce quality pieces for our customers. Our production is based in Albania, a small country in Europe, where nowadays many well-known international companies have chosen to produce their goods, and their craftsmen have years experience in handmade shoe manufacture market.

    

Our handmade MartinWalkers are made with lots of love and passion by the most skilled shoemakers. We've tested them in different types of potential customers and the feedback was very good.

    

 

Everything began as a brainstorm of creating something beautiful and affordable, to wear it daily, with timeless design. In my mind I had the vision of a modern designed slipper, but I didn’t had a lot of experience in the field of manufacture and shoe industry.

On the other hand, my father has been part of the shoe industry and market places for more than a decade. He has the key success of knowledge and experience that I need.

During my way of exploring and collecting data for this new business idea,  Jona also joined our team, a marketing partner, who has taken care of development and presentation of our project, sharing fresh new ideas for the way of conception and transmission our startup to the audience. 

So we put together a team, with passion and dedicated work, based on this three basic foundations as: design(modern) , affordable(economic) &
column5:
quality(experience).

We share the same vision that “Something made out of love, won’t get lost or underestimated”.

We guarantee you that our handmade MartinWalkers are made with lots of love and passion. We have dedicated everything more than two years on creating high quality shoes, but with fair prices.

 

Risk and Challenges

During our way, as many other new startups, we had a lot of up’s and down’s. The biggest challenge was finding the best suppliers, who accept small orders, but at the same time comply with our vision and values.

Another one, was trusting our production in small artisan family owned factories, which share the same passion and dedication for handmade shoes. We do not accept compromises on the quality of raw materials and manufacturing. This is the key of our success, which we are competing with other brands.

Last but not least, another big challenge was financial capital. As we know, in most of production fields and not only, founders need capital for the first orders and the launch of a new startup line.

We have trusted our work to Indiegogo community, hoping that we will get your support on bringing our first brand line to life. At this way we can start the production and shipping around the world.

Thank you for allowing us to do what we love and for spreading the word. Thank you for trusting us.

Martin Walker Team

 

Don’t worry to much about size and color right now. You have plenty of time to make up your mind. At the end of the campaign our team will contact each of our backers.

Take a look below !

 

 

HEY YOU, LITTLE REMINDER: ""LIFE IS SHORT, BUY THE SHOES""
Zoom your favorite and back us now !

<div>
Hi friends, we are Sene.

We launched our company over three years ago and are based in Los Angeles. Since the beginning, we've taken high-end tailoring and combined it with technical fabrics so you can have quality clothing that’s both comfortable and makes you look great. We have thousands of customers around the world, and have two locations in Los Angeles.
Today we're taking that approach to the next level, with the custom FlexTech Suit.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figure style=""margin: 0px
We're humbled by what people are saying.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Introducing the FlexTech Suit
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Most suits are uncomfortable.  ""Performance suits"" often are designed by athletic companies with little experience in premium tailoring.
Sene's FlexTech Suit combines the technical detailing of a $3000 bespoke suit with athleisure material from the top performance fabric mill in the world.
Plus it's for women too, not just men.
The FlexTech Suit: High-end tailoring meets radical comfort
Available at an exclusive Kickstarter price:
<ul>
•  Custom Two-Piece FlexTech Suit: $469 (MSRP $695)
•  Custom FlexTech Blazer: $359 (MSRP $500)
•  Custom FlexTech Pants: $129 (MSRP $195)
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<ul>
•  Four-way stretch: Radical flexibility, making it the perfect travel suit
•  Quick dry / moisture wicking: Spill liquid on yourself? Sweat easily? Don't worry - our moisture wicking technology will handle whatever your adventures throw at you

•  The same quality as a $3000 bespoke suit: No corners are cut in the construction of this garment. We literally use the exact same craftsmanship applied for our high-end $3000 suits, the only difference is the FlexTech fabric
<li> <strong>Beautiful &amp
column2: functional: The FlexTech Suit is designed to look great across activities and lifestyles, from the office to brunch to a night out. Multiple pockets, and durable construction complete the outfit

column1: •  Custom fit: A few sizes do not fit all. We custom-make the fit so that you get exactly what you want, no matter what size you are
You'll find the same bespoke detailing used in a $3000 suit. Plus plenty of pockets for phone, wallet, and other goodies.
Shopping custom is risk-free with our 60 Day Fit-Guarantee
<figure style=""margin: 0px
""What happens if it doesn't fit?""
We are so confident in our process that we guarantee an amazing fit. Once you receive your FlexTech suit, try-out the fit for 60 days.
If the fit is off, remakes and alterations are free (shipping included).
The perfect travel suit: from plane to meeting, no steaming required
<figure style=""margin: 0px
There's no doubt this will become your go-to when you travel.
<ul>
•  Feel ridiculously comfortable onboard with our four-way stretch athleisure fabric
•  Look sharp when you land with wrinkle-resistant fabric
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Custom-made for real life.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Since it's custom, you will select design details, like whether you want zipper pockets, regular pockets or no pockets
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Designed to be versatile, you can easily wear the blazer and pants separately.
<div data-caption=""Note: How long and fitted the pants are is customizable"" data-id=""24906074"">
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figcaption>Note: How long and fitted the pants are is customizable</figcaption>
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figure style=""margin: 0px
All bodies welcome.
<figure style=""margin: 0px

Because we make everything from scratch to fit, we can accommodate any body type. Whether you are petite, plus-size, lift heavy or another shape, Sene will look amazing on you and feel even more amazing as you move in them.
<div data-caption=""How the double-breasted jacket looks, as shot by The Garment Life"" data-id=""24959515"">
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figcaption>How the double-breasted jacket looks, as shot by The Garment Life</figcaption>
Our 1-to-1 model: Only make clothing if there is someone to wear it

Fashion is the 2nd most wasteful industry in the world, with $5 billion dollars of clothing being thrown away every year. We believe the only way to solve it is to nip the problem in the bud - don't make clothes if there isn't someone to wear it.
So we make everything on-demand and custom-fit.
<figure style=""margin: 0px

For our FlexTech fabric, we created it with a Japanese mill known for fabric innovation, serving other clients such as Lululemon. More importantly, they are committed to net zero emissions, using recycled synthetics, and upholding cleaner air and water standards.
Customize the design to your liking
Blazer customization
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Pant customization
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Create your custom fit with our Smart Fit Quiz
<figure style=""margin: 0px
(Smart Fit Quiz in action below)
<figure style=""margin: 0px

Upon completion of the campaign, you will be invited to take the Smart Fit Quiz, which is a 19 question quiz. We have a machine learning algorithm based on thousands of body measurements that we use to generate the custom fit. Below are points of customization:
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Each garment is laser cut, hand-assembled and then delivered to your home
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Your garment goes through a thorough production process, and each piece is made one at a time to order.
There are multiple quality check points across the production process to ensure the fit and craftsmanship are up-to-par.
We have three years of experience and thousands of loyal repeat customers
Ray Li and Mark Zheng are the partners behind Sene. Our mission is to use elevated design to empower people of all shapes and sizes to feel their best.
<figure style=""margin: 0px

Sene started in Ray's tiny studio apartment, confusing his doorman with why so many boxes were going out the door. Before launching Sene, Ray was running global rebrands for tech and consumer product companies. Ray started out his career with global process transformations at Deloitte Consulting.

Mark is Ray's cousin, and used to build valuation models for the healthcare industry. Mark is the brains behind Sene's smart fit algorithm and has worked with our factories to connect our patterning software with the production process.
Today their team and advisory board brings experience from places like Deloitte Consulting, Google, IDEO and Interbrand.
Based in Los Angeles, our team has offices in the Pacific Design Center and OneCulver. If you prefer to get fitted in-person, book an appointment online with us after you purchase.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
People are in love.
Steve Asbell, Senior Vice President of Production at 20th Century Fox
""The FlexTech suit is extraordinary! It's lightweight, breathable, and holds its shape really well. It's a perfect suit for my work week.""
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Brittany Ishibashi, Star of Marvel's Runaways

""You guys know I love Sene - custom clothing, quick turnaround, great people! Well, they’re launching a Kickstarter to jumpstart new colors and styles for THIS SUIT. It’s a special fabric (#flextech) that somehow manages to be super comfortable and super chic at the same time.""
<div data-caption=""Brittany Ishibashi (Star of Marvel's Runaways)"" data-id=""24974080"">
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figcaption>Brittany Ishibashi (Star of Marvel's Runaways)</figcaption>
Sterling K Brown, Emmy Award Winner for Best Actor, and star of TV Show This Is Us
<div data-caption=""Emmy Best Actor Winner Sterling K Brown (Star of This Is Us) in the Black FlexTech Suit"" data-id=""24974200"">
<figure style=""margin: 0px
<figcaption>Emmy Best Actor Winner Sterling K Brown (Star of This Is Us) in the Black FlexTech Suit</figcaption>
What do I do now?
Back this project, get fitted and look amazing + comfortable. You're covered by our 60 Day Fit Guarantee.
<figure style=""margin: 0px
Support and share the project!
Note: If you would like to receive a 10% commission for every order made through your sharing efforts, you can sign up via Kickbooster.
What if I have questions?
Hit up our FAQ on this page or visit senestudio.com and message us on chat.

ArtAtomic Scarves!

Wearable art from code, inspired by Chemistry and Physics!
Art you can wear! These gorgeous scarves are printed with Generative Artworks created with code, inspired by Chemistry and Physics.

With code, I create particle systems. As the simulation runs, the particles bump into each other, changing and growing. The patterns, shapes and colors,  slowly emerge like a blooming garden.
It all started when I was developing chemistry animations for students.
The particles each have their own 'atomic number', which determines how
it interacts with other particles in the system.  Hydrogen atoms bound

with Oxygen atoms to form water molecules, and so on.


What We Need &
First goal: produce a range of generative art scarves inspired by Chemistry, Physics, and Mathematics.
Stretch goal: produce clothing from textiles inspired by Chemistry, Physics, and Mathematics.
Funding Needs:
<ul>
• Starting with minimal funding goals, so that we can produce the scarves and offer them in the Indiegogo InDemand market.
• By printing scarves on-demand with a local textile printer, we can deliver all perks, even if we don't meet our funding goal.
• Stretch goal:  produce quantity with costs that allow whole-sale prices so that we can be carried by small boutiques.
Perks:
Wearable Art Perks!
Coloring books &
Wall art Perks!

The Impact

What is the impact?   Spreading a little science love, in a beautiful wearable way.
If we meet our initial goals, we'll start looking at stretch goals to
fund videos and tutorials on creative and scientific coding. If you're
especially interested in this, please let us know!

My generative artwork, inspired by math and science, has already been shown in galleries, pop-up shows, and installation events. My goal is to not only make beautiful art, but to reveal the beauty of Science and Mathematics in every day life.
Risks &
So far, my work's been on paper and metal,  with colors turning out how I expect them to.
Printing on textiles allows me to explore a whole new dimension.  The inks and dyes react
differently on different fabrics. What looks like a deep marsala red on
paper may look bright pumpkin-orange on silk. Quite startling!
We've got blue-green designs ready for production, and they look fantastic!
The tricky part is working with reds and browns when printing on textiles. It requires a lot of color corrections and test printing on each fabric before the design is ready for production.
<ul>
• Initial test prints and visiting the textile printing company has already brought us closer to our goal.
• We now have Pantone color swatches for several fabric types, and are ready to start color corrections and run test prints for any design with red-pink-orange-brown colors in it.
About me and my Art
With code, I create art inspired by Chemistry and
Physics: Generative Art. It's been shown in galleries and events from San Francisco to
Scarborough, UK.
Past projects include myCitySounds, and art installation I developed as a fellow at Stamen and Gray Area.

Now I'm working on making my art wearable, printing my artwork on textile and creating a line of Generative Art scarves.

I've spent so much time and effort making the
science and technical aspects of my work appealing and apparently
simple, that it's challenging to talk up the difficulties. But then,
it's like Ballet...making the difficult appear effortless and graceful.
Underneath the artworks are the simple patterns of nature and the molecular world.
Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love it if you helped us get the word out.  Make some noise about this project!

Indiegogo has sharing tools, built in, so it’s really easy to help spread the word!

column2: >I have my home where me and my family have everything we need,
column3: >we have enough to eat and drink and I can enjoy my beloved cup of coffee in the morning ...
column4: >...but there are many people who have none of these things
column5:
>...and besides that I have my work which I love with all my heart. 

By buying my necklace you will give hope for a new life to homeless people.
column8: >My name is Veronika Kocisova. I live in Bratislava, the capital of Slovakia, with my family – my husband and my two little angels :-). I make jewelry – it is both my work and my passion. I have learned to make jewelry myself. I have not studied goldsmithery or jewelry and I am constantly learning. I like working with metals, especially copper and my great inspiration is wabi sabi aesthetics – the theory of imperfect beauty centered on the acceptance of transience and imperfection, searching for love “at the second sight”. I perceive jewelry as reflections of us people – we are also imperfect but still unique and beautiful, everyone in a different way. All my jewels are made in my small home-based workshop.
column9:
>


One necklace will spread love and help to many
column10: >I realize that I am a happy person. I have my family, we are healthy, we have our home, we have work and we do not lack anything that we need for contended life. But there are many people around us who are not so lucky. I try to help within my limits as much as I can. And now I would like to “extend it a little”. I would like to give pleasure to you through the jewelry I make with love and you may delight someone else
column11: >with them to close the circle (or just yourself, of course :-)). With the purchase of my jewelry you will support the non-profit organization Depaul which will take care of hundreds of people
column12:
> and with a small sum also me so that I could continue in my work and progress. 

What is Depaul Slovakia?
column13: >Non-profit organization Depaul Slovakia runs the reception center and shelter for homeless people in Bratislava (capital of Slovakia). The facility was established in 2006. The initiative was set in motion following the severe winter 2005/2006 which resulted in death of as many as 19 homeless people in Bratislava. At that time, a tent city for 140 homeless people was established but it did not provide the permanent solution to the problem.
column14:
>

That was the impulse for them to embark on the search for the solution to this problem. A reception center of Saint Vincent De Paul was established for this purpose and now provides a shelter to about 150 homeless people.

The facility has provided a shelter more than 300,000 times since it was established. We could see last winter which was similar to the fatal one in 2005/2006 that the facility has been established to a good purpose. Dozens of people died of hypothermia in the surrounding countries but Bratislava fortunately did not experience such scenario.

“We want to help as many homeless people as possible. However, we now also need some help.” Depaul organization needs finances to continue running the reception center and provide food for homeless people.  


Jewelry 

My necklaces are made with love and they ""carry"" something, what is important for you. You can buy it for yourself and have stamped some strong words, that give you power and wear it as an amulet. You can buy it for your loved one, as a ""promise"" necklace. You can have stamped on your necklace names of your loved ones and have them always near your heart.

You can choose from more possibilities, just choose that one, that speaks to your soul :-)
column15: >When you purchase the jewel worth 55 euros, you will receive a handmade personalized lavaliere necklace made of german (nickel) silver and copper, hung on the silver-plate chain. Hand-carved plates of size 2.5 cm and 2.2 cm, are hammered, patinated and the upper one has a soldered carved copper heart. I will stamp the text at your request (names, initials, date, word that has a special meaning for you) on the bottom plate. The silver-plate chain is 50 cm (20"") long.
column16:
>

When you purchase the jewel in the value of 25 euro, you will receive a handmade lavaliere necklace made from copper (or german silver or mixed metal - upon your wish) and hung on silver-plated chain. The hand-carved plates in the size of 2 and 1.5 cm are hammered and patinated. I will stamp a word/date/initials, upon your request and also a butterfly if you wish in the bottom plate. Heart is stamped in the upper plate (if you wish without, just let me know). The necklace is sealed and hung on the silver-plated chain 50 cm (20"") long.

column1:
Please, do not forget to write a note in the message, what you would like to have engraved in the lavaliere necklace.

Copper v
column6:
>

German silver version

Mixed metal version A

Mixed metal version B

The necklaces are handmade so they can differ from the one in the picture (every piece is original). Shipping costs are included.

How the money will be used?

The target sum is 5,000 euros while Depaul organization needs 3,000 euros for its further operation (for this year). If I succeed in collecting this sum with your help, I will need 2,000 to purchase the needed material, pay charges and a small part will be used as a compensation for work so that I can make this number of lavaliere necklaces for you. I would also like to invest in the purchase of the missing equipment of the workshop so that I can continue learning and progressing in my work.

column1:
If I do not succeed in reaching the target sum, 60% of the collected sum will go to the organization Depaul and the rest will be used for material, charges and investment in the workshop.

I live in Bratislava, the capital of Slovakia, with my family – my husband and my two little angels :-). I make jewelry – it is both my work and my passion. I have learned to make jewelry myself. I have not studied goldsmithery or jewelry and I am constantly learning. I like working with metals, especially copper and my great inspiration is wabi sabi aesthetics – the theory of imperfect beauty centered on the acceptance of transience and imperfection, searching for love “at the second sight”. I perceive jewelry as reflections of us people – we are also imperfect but still unique and beautiful, everyone in a different way. All my jewels are made in my small home-based workshop. One necklace will spread love and help to many I realize that I am a happy person. I have my family, we are healthy, we have our home, we have work and we do not lack anything that we need for contended life. But there are many people around us who are not so lucky. I try to help within my limits as much as I can. And now I would like to “extend it a little”. I would like to give pleasure to you through the jewelry I make with love and you may delight someone else with them to close the circle (or just yourself, of course :-)). With the purchase of my jewelry you will support the non-profit organization Depaul which will take care of hundreds of people and with a small sum also me so that I could continue in my work and progress. What is Depaul Slovakia? Non-profit organization Depaul Slovakia runs the reception center and shelter for homeless people in Bratislava (capital of Slovakia). The facility was established in 2006. The initiative was set in motion following the severe winter 2005/2006 which resulted in death of as many as 19 homeless people in Bratislava. At that time, a tent city for 140 homeless people was established but it did not provide the permanent solution to the problem.  That was the impulse for them to embark on the search for the solution to this problem. A reception center of Saint Vincent De Paul was established for this purpose and now provides a shelter to about 150 homeless people.The facility has provided a shelter more than 300,000 times since it was established. We could see last winter which was similar to the fatal one in 2005/2006 that the facility has been established to a good purpose. Dozens of people died of hypothermia in the surrounding countries but Bratislava fortunately did not experience such scenario.“We want to help as many homeless people as possible. However, we now also need some help.” Depaul organization needs finances to continue running the reception center and provide food for homeless people.  Jewelry My necklaces are made with love and they ""carry"" something, what is important for you. You can buy it for yourself and have stamped some strong words, that give you power and wear it as an amulet. You can buy it for your loved one, as a ""promise"" necklace. You can have stamped on your necklace names of your loved ones and have them always near your heart.You can choose from more possibilities, just choose that one, that speaks to your soul :-)When you purchase the jewel worth 55 euros, you will receive a handmade personalized lavaliere necklace made of german (nickel) silver and copper, hung on the silver-plate chain. Hand-carved plates of size 2.5 cm and 2.2 cm, are hammered, patinated and the upper one has a soldered carved copper heart. I will stamp the text at your request (names, initials, date, word that has a special meaning for you) on the bottom plate. The silver-plate chain is 50 cm (20"") long. When you purchase the jewel in the value of 25 euro, you will receive a handmade lavaliere necklace made from copper (or german silver or mixed metal - upon your wish) and hung on silver-plated chain. The hand-carved plates in the size of 2 and 1.5 cm are hammered and patinated. I will stamp a word/date/initials, upon your request and also a butterfly if you wish in the bottom plate. Heart is stamped in the upper plate (if you wish without, just let me know). The necklace is sealed and hung on the silver-plated chain 50 cm (20"") long.

column1: Please, do not forget to write a note in the message, what you would like to have engraved in the lavaliere necklace.Copper versionGerman silver versionMixed metal version AMixed metal version BThe necklaces are handmade so they can differ from the one in the picture (every piece is original). Shipping costs are included.How the money will be used?The target sum is 5,000 euros while Depaul organization needs 3,000 euros for its further operation (for this year). If I succeed in collecting this sum with your help, I will need 2,000 to purchase the needed material, pay charges and a small part will be used as a compensation for work so that I can make this number of lavaliere necklaces for you. I would also like to invest in the purchase of the missing equipment of the workshop so that I can continue learning and progressing in my work.

If I do not succeed in reaching the target sum, 60% of the collected sum will go to the organization Depaul and the rest will be used for material, charges and investment in the workshop. SPREAD LOVE <3Thank you for supporting a good cause!",11.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Bratislava, Slovakia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/personalized-handmade-necklace-that-will-spread-love-and-hope-to-many/pica

Translate into Japanese

You want a smartwatch that respects your time. We created GLIGO to do just that. 

No crazy/flashy UX and alerts that never stop. We only keep track of the most important things for you throughout the day: check time, meeting reminder, and a little bit of health monitoring and fitness tracking.  

While giving you the most comfortable watch-reading experience, GLIGO also has unprecedentedly long battery life. Different from most of the smartwatches on the market that require charges daily, we adopted an energy-efficient dual-core design: the quartz core has a battery life of up to two years, e-ink screen has a battery life of up to 180 days.
<div><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe src=""https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZCazF3wkeho?autohide=1&amp

column24: >We strive for simplicity and functionality, and always with style. With GLIGO
column46:
>, you can focus on the things you care the most about. 

GLIGO
column68:
>’s screen is e-ink, and there is no reflection under the sun like traditional liquid crystal displays have. And it only consumes energy when screen color changes (e.g., switching from black to white). After turning off, images on screen remain, hence very energy-efficient. 

Another advantage of e-ink screen over traditional liquid crystal display is that it is easy to read. E-ink looks like printed text, making it easier for eyes.​
column112: >Press the bottom-right button on GLIGO and switch between black and white screens freely. Given your environment, choose mature black or chic white.
column134:
>The watch has a two-pin design and is equipped with quartz movement. The e-ink screen displays time, date, and notification icons.

GLIGO’s waterproof body can withstand depths up to 30 meters. So now you don't have to worry about taking off your watch when you're showering, at the beach, or working out.
column157: >Let us first introduce to you the reminder functions under four innovative scenarios.
column179: >Mobile phone reminders are automatically synced to the watch, and the e-ink screen will display the reminder in different time intervals. For example, if you have an important meeting between 10 am, and 12 pm, the outer circle between 10 and 12 will show white, reminding you that there is a meeting during this period.
column201: >The display is black or white background
column202: there are agendas reminder lines for next 12 hours (as you see, there are lines around the display edge, when your calendar has tasks in those hours, the display will show a range at that hour).
column224: >You can set and view your full daily schedule easily. As shown in image above, the watch face shows that you have some upcoming appointments at 11:50 AM, 14:30 PM and 18:30 PM.
column246: ><strong>The screen background is black or white
column247: there’s a ring around the display edge which we called sports amount ring, it goes as your sports amount increase until you fulfill your target sports amount which is set through mobile App.
column269: >Black or white background, the display shows a digital time or date, which is in sync with your mobile phone time or date through the mobile phone app. So when you travel to different time zone, the display can show time of different time zones.
column291:
>When you have traveled to France from American, GLIGO’s quartz hands show the local current time in US (e.g. 10:10 AM) and its face shows the local current time in French (3:10 PM) at the same time. And it also can show the date in French (Oct. 10th).

GLIGO features email alerts, call alerts, and application alerts so that you have to take out your mobile phone or notebook to check them. Life can be simple and easier.

The GliGo Watch application allows your GLIGO to connect seamlessly with your phone, enabling you to access stored information in real time, use your GLIGO to take pictures, and program your reminders as well as your mode choices.

Quick, convenient magnetic charging technology can be used to provide charging power to the E-ink screen alone
column292: the quartz core has a battery life of up to 2 years.
column314: >Robust body with streamline makes this smart watch resistant to high temperature, corrosion and tear and wear, allowing for a long lasting use.
column330:
>

Do sports with GLIGO. It tracks everything from your steps, running distance and heart rate. It can also remind you to take a rest. Its sleep monitor tracks your sleep patterns - when you go to sleep and wake up.

There are two different styles for you to choose from: Classic Leather or Stylish Milanese, don't miss the opportunity to show your style.

All silver design fits the most occasions

THE MEANING BEHIND THE ICONIC L3VEL LOGO ( kid with headphones )


     The meaning behind this L3vel Character is whats makes him unique and original. The X's for the eyes represents most people in the world who go about their lives and don't care to see what is really going on in the world. The half zipped mouth represents people who are scared or don't care to speak up on the issues we're facing in society. The headphones represent people who don't care to listen to what's going on in the world around them. This logo was influence by the carving in Japan of the three monkeys of wisdom, sometimes called the Three Mystic Apes. Together, they embody the proverbial principle of ""see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil."" There are various meanings ascribed to the monkeys and proverb, including associations with being of good mind, speech, and action. In the Western world the phrase refers to those who deal with impropriety by the process of ignoring unpopular orders or inconvenient truths or activities.  


Our story

     Hi, my name is R.J. “L3vel” Wilson and I am the C.E.O. of L3vel Nation Clothing Co. I started L3vel Nation in October of 2011. Since then I have had partners that have come and gone. I have lost people, because I dedicate all my time into L3vel nation and I felt they didn't believe in my dreams.  Now L3vel nation finally has a firm team that is more dedicated and ambitious than myself.  L3vel Nation has two VP’s that are marines like me and we are like brothers. We have hit many walls, but we have not let that affect us and we will not allow anything to stop us from making the L3vel nation dream a reality. We have put our all into L3vel Nation to keep it afloat and we will do anything to make L3vel Nation the next big thing.

     L3vel Nation aims to open people’s eyes with its designs which deal with political and social themes. So that people will realize what is going on around them and actually begin to care. L3vel Nation is aiming to appeal to all ages and ethical groups. Currently L3vel Nation is mainly an urban skate brand. We have a skate team and snowboarding team that we are currently building. L3vel Nation sponsors a long list of musicians and artists across the country that embody what L3vel Nation stands for. We want to give people opportunities that they normally don't have by throwing events every other month to raise awareness on issues in society and to allow people to showcase their talent by performing.  L3vel Nation also enjoys doing things in the community, like adopt a highway and serving food at the Salvation Army every other weekend. Once we expand, we would like to donate a percentage of each shirt sold to selected charities. Eventually we want to travel and help people around the world.

     We are trying to not only create a clothing line but a positive movement that will hopefully sculpt our society a little bit in positive ways.  L3vel Nation is made up of individuals who have been through it all. We have come from nothing and weren't given anything by anyone. We are strong passionate individuals because we grew up working hard for what we have. We ignored all the negativity around us and didn't get influenced by the things around us. We strive to be the best in what we do as marines, brothers, sons, and members of society.

column1: <b style=""font-size: 15px

Our mission is to create a large body of people with the same belief: that the world is what you make of it.  We also aim to help open the world's eyes to what is going on in the world so that they can realize what is happening and start to care. Another goal is to help people stand up and not be scared to voice their opinions by wearing L3vel Nation apparel.  Our biggest goal is to try to make this world a better place by raising awareness of what's happening around us and by encouraging people to really search for the truth. L3VEL Nation clothing puts this state of mind into artwork that defines you. L3VEL Nation aims to help you break away from anything that is holding you back and allows you to make a statement and take a stance against everyone and anything that doubts you. So when people ask, ""what is 'L3VEL Nation'?"" You can tell them ""It's a lifestyle."" One in which you can exceed any expectations, overcome any obstacles, and express yourself. ""The world is what you paint of it.""

Why we need the money!!!!

     Our product has been proven to sell. We are selling faster then we can get the clothes made. We are wanting to go to MAGIC S.L.A.T.E trade show in Las Vegas in 2014. This is probably the biggest trade-show in america. Just about every major brand exhibits in this trade-show and it's the proven grounds for any new brand. We feel that we could easily stand alongside these major brands and do well.  

     We just need the asking amount to be able to do so. With the asking amount we plan on getting new inventory, pay for our spot, pay traveling expenses, props, decorations, for our area. We appropriate you reading this and hope you can help us make our dream a reality!!!

235% funded, 148 backers on Kickstarter

Alvieri watches feature a convex hour track on the dial which comes alive when the light hits it at an angle. The dial also displays a beautiful guilloche pattern which reflects light in a myriad of different ways. They look oh so impressive! They are made of high quality materials. Hmmmm sounds expensive? Nope, the price is affordable.

Hands on review:

Wristwatchreview: ""I found the Alvieri Firenze to be a very capable, and seemingly well-built, watch in my time with it. You’ve got solid materials, a known Swiss movement, and some rather interesting styling.

We're a group of people who are passionate about watches. We realized there was a need for an affordable elegant watch that has a distinctive look. Then, we set out to create a watch brand that embraced the three dimensional beauty. In early 2015, we built Alvieri LLC which is based in Nevada, United States.

Alvieri is derived from “alive”, the word we use to describe our dial and because Italy is where we got the inspiration of our design, we use the Italian-sounding name that is spelled with almost the same letters.

Our logo consists of interlocking infinity symbols forming a quadruple ‘a’. The first letter ‘a’ stands for Alvieri. The other three ‘a’ letters are meant to exhibit the core values which Alvieri stands for: artistico (artistic), altaqualità (amazing quality), and abbordabile (affordable). The Infinity shapes are drawn with different stroke thicknesses, pointing to the importance of depth in our three-dimensional design.

 

Our watches are made in a world class factory which, for decades, has been producing luxury watches that retail around the world for over $1000. 

Sapphire glass  

The world’s most expensive timepieces have a sapphire glass covering the dial because sapphire is extremely scratch-resistant. However, sapphire is expensive so most watches under $300 have a mineral crystal or sapphire coated instead, which isn’t as scratch resistant as sapphire crystal. Our crystal is not sapphire coated but 100% sapphire crystal! 

Swiss quartz movement  

All Alvieri watches are powered by Ronda movements. Ronda is a high tech Swiss movement manufacturer in Switzerland and one of the best manufactures of quartz movement in the world.  

Genuine Italian leather  

Every Alvieri watch is paired with a genuine Italian leather strap. Italian leather is famous in the fashion industry as the best of its kind due to the quality of the leather itself.  

Our logo and a unique serial number is engraved on the case back of Alvieri watch to distinguish them from one another.

Firenze Classic Edition

This edition offers a clean dial for a simple, yet classy appearance. The dial accentuates a guilloché with twelve sectors of concentric texture that radiate from the center.

Specifications  

Function: Time only, 2 hands

Movement: Ronda Swiss quartz movement Caliber 513

Case size: 40mm diameter, 9mm thick

Case material: Brushed/polished 316 stainless steel

Crystal: Sapphire with an AR coating

Strap material: Genuine Italian leather

Strap width: 20mm

Weight (with strap): 62 grams

Water resistance: 50mm / 5ATM

Battery: Swiss Renata

Warranty: 2 years

 

Firenze Lunar Edition 

This edition features a date aperture at 6 O’ Clock and the current phase of the moon as you can see it in the sky through an aperture on the dial.

Specifications  

Function: Moon-phase &
column2:
date indicators, two hands 

Movement: Ronda Swiss quartz movement Caliber 708 

Case Size: 40mm diameter, 9mm thick 

Case material: Brushed/polished 316 stainless steel

Crystal: Sapphire crystal with an AR coating

Strap material: Genuine Italian leather 

Strap width: 20mm 

Weight (with strap): 62 grams

Water resistance: 50mm / 5ATM 

Battery: Swiss Renata

Warranty: 2 years

We want to say a big thank you for checking out our project. We sincerely need your support. Even if you can't support us with a pledge, why not help us by spreading the word on Twitter, Facebook and any other social network you're on. Thanks for your help! Click any of the links below to share:  

 

 

 

If you have any concerns, please don't hesitate to contact us at hello@Alvieriwatches.com or leave a message in Indiegogo for us.
